I'm wondering if/how folks have solved this problem (for all I know it
may already be a JUnit Recipe):

I'm maintaining a complex, headless (fortunately!) legacy batch-mode
app: a bash script starts an Eclipse RCP app, which runs Ant scripts,
which do stuff (headlessly, fortunately) in a filesystem. We have bugs
of known cause that we know will make the app infinite-loop, for which
we test manually. We have bugs of unknown cause that make the app's
runtime tend to increase over time running on the same inputs.

Accordingly I'd like to automate the regression test for that with a
test that starts the app and fails if the app does not complete in
some defined time. I'm assuming I want to do something like the
sequence [create a thread, start the app, sleep for given time, fail
if app not completed], but I've never coded that (i.e. I'll probably
screw up :-), so if there's framework methods I can use, or if someone
can point me toward sample code, I'd appreciate it.
